definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: The mother tiptoed into the room for fear that she should wake up her sleeping baby.
sentences.chinese: 母亲踮起脚尖走进房间，惟恐惊醒正在熟睡的宝宝。

sentences.english: He turned his toes out like Chaplin.
sentences.chinese: 他像卓别林那样把脚尖向外撇。

sentences.english: Why did the blonde tip-toe past the medicine cabinet?
sentences.chinese: 为什么美女踮着脚尖走过药品箱？
芭蕾舞演员连续用脚尖旋转。

sentences.english: On tiptoes I reached up and opened the heavy door.
sentences.chinese: 我踮起脚尖伸手摸索着打开了它厚重的门。

sentences.english: RHT Reinforced Heel even as well even as Toe;
sentences.chinese: 脚尖和脚跟都有加厚层珍惜。

sentences.english: Don't put the ads will shorten to not stood on tiptoe can see the place.
sentences.chinese: 不要把聚光点缩短到不踮起脚尖就可以看到的地方。

sentences.english: He tip-toed to the door in his stockinged feet.
sentences.chinese: 他踮着脚尖走到门口，只穿着袜子没穿鞋。

sentences.english: The waves will stand a-tiptoe to kiss your neck and whisper in your ears.
sentences.chinese: 波浪踮着脚尖亲吻你的颈脖，在你耳旁呢喃。

sentences.english: The trees like the longings of the earth stand a tiptoe to peep at the heaven.
sentences.chinese: 绿树仿佛在表示对大地的渴望，踮起脚尖，窥视天空。

sentences.english: And he advanced on the tips of his boots towards the corner which Marius had turned.
sentences.chinese: 他踮起长统靴的脚尖朝着马吕斯拐弯的那个墙角走去。

sentences.english: He touched his toes to the horse's flanks.
sentences.chinese: 他把脚尖轻触在马的侧腹。

sentences.english: Secondly, walking on tiptoes will help make one's eyesight better.
sentences.chinese: 其次，将有助于踮起脚尖走路地目力更好。

sentences.english: Suzy likes to pirouette from room to room on her tippy toes.
sentences.chinese: 苏茜喜欢用脚尖在房间之间旋转。

sentences.english: Tiptoe to outside rotation, heel to close within.
sentences.chinese: 脚尖向外转动，脚跟向内靠紧。

sentences.english: His hat, aslant over his brow, and took a pose on his toes for all of us.
sentences.chinese: 他手中擎着帽子，斜着眉毛，用脚尖摆个姿势给我们。

definition: to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
to draw together/to place side by side (e.g. one's fingers, two halves of a torn sheet of paper etc)
